title: [$250] Add extra logs to the useSidebarOrderedReports hook

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1757427870254749?thread_ts=1756201512.926039&cid=C05LX9D6E07) ### Background The useSidebarOrderedReports hook manages and sorts reports data. It processes large amounts of information, including chat reports, policies, and transactions. The hook includes a logChangedDeps function that tracks dependency changes and logs performance metrics. ### Problem The current measurement only captures the logging overhead via processingDuration, not the actual data processing time. As a result, we lack visibility into how expensive this hook is during renders, making it difficult to detect or diagnose performance regressions. ### Solution Enhance the logging in useSidebarOrderedReports by: - Measuring the actual execution time of the hook’s data processing logic. - Tracking component usage alongside corresponding render durations.

title: [$250] Forbid inline useOnyx selectors

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

labels.name: AutoAssignerNewDotQuality
labels.description: Used to assign quality issues to engineers

body:
coming from [this proposal](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1757428589519799) ### Background Selectors in react-native-onyx are functions that allow to subscribe a subset of data from storage, providing performance benefits by only re-rendering components when the selected data changes, rather than when any property in the entire object changes. They transform, filter, or extract specific data and support type-safe operations on both individual keys and collections. Recently we merged a couple of improvements to useOnyx, including the memoization working properly with stable references. However, most of our codebase still uses inline selectors, which prevents us from taking advantage of these optimizations. ### Problem When using selectors in useOnyx, if you define the selector as inline function directly in the options object, then the memoization system breaks causing unnecessary re-computations and re-renders on every component update. ### Solution Make selectors first-class citizens in E/App by organizing them according to their usage scope: - Shared selectors: if a selector is reused across multiple components, define it in a dedicated selectors/ directory so it can be consistently imported and reused. - Local selectors: if a selector exists purely for the needs of a single component or hook, define it in the same file outside the component where it’s used to avoid unnecessary abstraction. - Contextual selectors: if a selector relies on additional data from the component itself, define it as a useCallback inside the component, with the relevant data passed as dependencies.

User clicks “Book Travel” in NewDot without validating their account. 2. The system displays an unclear error and does not show the expected OTP validation screen or even the same error as Classic: When verification is needed: | Classic | NewDot | |--------|--------| | | | Usually when the NewDot error shows, an Enable issue is created for Concierge but in this instance, it isn't. ## Expected Result: - NewDot should show the OTP code input screen and send the validation email. - Error messaging should align with other validation flows. - If validation fails, show the normal error message about OTP validation fails - Once validation is complete, proceed with the normal onboarding flow for Expensify Travel ## Actual Result: - Error is shown without resolution path. - No OTP email is sent. - No issue is created in the backend. ## Workaround: User must validate their account manually before attempting again. ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop
